name: University of Silesia in Katowice (Uniwersytet Śląski w Katowicach)
goal:
University of Silesia in Katowice is a public higher education institution operating on the basis of the Act of 27th of July 2005 – Law on Higher Education, the Ordinance of the Council of Ministers of 8th of June 1968 on establishing the University of Silesia in Katowice
and the Statute. The University has legal personality. The University is autonomous in all areas of its activity pursuant to the rules laid down in Law on Higher Education. University is governed by the principles of academic freedom in teaching, scientific research and artistic creativity. Rector holds the highest office at the University and represents the University externally.

The University performs the tasks specified in the Act, and in particular:
1. educates students and doctoral students at the undergraduate, masters and doctoral level, as well as conducts other forms of educational activities,
2. conducts, initiates and supports scientific research, artistic, cultural and sports activities,
3. takes care to preserve academic traditions and customs,
4. actively supports local and regional communities;
5. implements the principle of equal opportunities and creates conditions for the full participation of disabled persons in the processes of learning, research and participation in academic life.

University of Silesia consists of 12 faculties:
1. Faculty of Fine Arts and Music
2. Faculty of Biology and Environmental Protection
3. Faculty of Ethnology and Educational Science
4. Faculty of Philology
5. Faculty of Computer Science and Materials Science
6. Faculty of Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry
7. Faculty of Earth Sciences
8. Faculty of Social Sciences
9. Faculty of Pedagogy and Psychology
10. Faculty of Law and Administration
11. Faculty of Radio and Television
12. Faculty of Theology
University of Silesia educates almost 26 000 students at 77 study programmes and 238 specialisations.
interests: Climate Action, Education, Environment, Research and Technology
euInitiatives: University of Silesia follows initiatives, policies and legislative proposals relating to reasearch and education.
